content: fingerless mittens with arch gusset by tania barley about this pattern these fingerless mittens are knitted in the round from the cuff up to the top and have an arched gusset that allows for a very comfortable fit they are cute warm and very practical for cold weather months i use them when taking my dogs for a walk going out early in the morning to feed the chickens or to bring some firewood in these mittens have a very simple colorwork design so if you have never knitted with 2 colours before this could be a perfect first project for you mittens are knitted on circular needles however you can also use double-pointed needles if you are more comfortable with them materials yarn istex lettlopi 50 grams - 100 m/109 yards or any other aran weight yarn ● colour a - 100 m/ 150 m ● colour b - 50 m gauge 20 st/30 row - 10 cm/ 4 inches in size b needles measurements taken flat after washing size s m / l ● width 9 cm/ 10 cm 3 5 inches/ 4 inches ● length 20 5 cm/ 22 cm 8 inches/ 8 6 inches needles circular needles size a - 2 5 mm circular needles size b - 3 mm or other to achieve gauge other materials waste yarn tapestry needle measuring tape 2 stitch markers incl unique marker for bor ©irishhomestead 2019 2 abbreviations k - knit pm - place marker sm - slip marker from left to right needle bor - beginning of row eor - end of round round - round m1 - make 1 increase by 1 stitch insert the left ​ needle from front to back into the horizontal strand between the two stitches knit the stitch through the back loop ©irishhomestead 2019 3 pattern cast on and cuff using any stretchy cast on method of your choice and size a needles cast on 40/44 stitches sample mittens shown in the pictures have been knit using tubular cast on method join your work in the round taking care not to twist the stitches and place a unique bor marker that will indicate the beginning of your round knit 1x1 rib k1 p1 for 16 row or till the cuff is 6 cm/ 2 4 inches or any other desired length gusset change to size b needle and continue knitting in stockinette for 4 row now we need to form a gusset of the mitten increasing the stitches for the thumb increases are done on the palm side of the mitten left mitten round 1 k 8/9 m1 pm knit till eor round 16 k18 m1 sm knit till eor round 2 k all stitches round 17 k19 m1 sm knit till eor round 3 k9/10 m1 sm knit till eor after round 17 you will have 20+12 stitches on the side of the gusset and 20 stitches round 4 k all stitches on the opposite side - total of 52 stitches
